meanings.definition: A small group of people with shared interests or tastes.
meanings.sent1: In our neighborhood, the book club is one of the many coteries that meet regularly.
meanings.sent2: The coteries of artists in the city often collaborate on projects together.
meanings.sent3: The coteries of bird watchers had a friendly competition to spot the rarest bird.
meanings.sent4: She navigated through the coteries of fashion designers, each with their unique style.
meanings.sent5: The coteries of gamers gathered around the table, eager to start the tournament.

meanings.definition: A clique or circle of people who associate closely.
meanings.sent1: At school, the coteries of friends always sat together during lunch.
meanings.sent2: The coteries of colleagues often went out for drinks after work.
meanings.sent3: The coteries of movie buffs had a movie marathon every weekend.
meanings.sent4: She found herself in the coteries of gossipers, sharing stories and rumors.
meanings.sent5: The coteries of hikers explored the trails together, enjoying the fresh air.
